title: Selected Topics in Computer Science; Principles of Software Verification
description: Prerequisite: Minimum grade of C- in CMSC330 and CMSC351; and permission of CMNS-Computer Science department. Or must be in the (Computer Science (Doctoral), Computer Science (Master's)) program. Introduces techniques for rigorously establishing that software behaves correctly. Topics to be covered include: preconditions and postconditions; loop invariants; contract-based specifications; techniques for proving programs correct; state-machine based system design; temporal logic; and model checking.
